articles.title: Disney stock falls as Disney+ subscribers decline amid push to lose less money in streaming
articles.content: Walt Disney Co. shares declined in late trading Wednesday following an earnings report that showed Disney+ subscribers declining in recent months.

articles.title: Robinhood Q1 Earnings Highlights: Revenue And EPS Beat, 24-Hour Trading Launch Featuring Select Stocks Such As Tesla
articles.content:
Trading platform company Robinhood Markets Inc (NASDAQ: HOOD) reported first-quarter financial results after the market close Wednesday. Here are the key highlights.
What Happened: Robinhood reported first-quarter revenue of $441 million, up 16% quarter-over-quarter. The total came in ahead of a Street consensus estimate of $424.5 million, according to data from Benzinga Pro.
The company reported a loss of 57 cents per share, which beat a Street estimate of a loss of 61 cents per share.
Transaction revenue totaled $207 million in the first quarter, which was up 11% year-over-year. Options revenue was $133 million, which was up 7% quarter-over-quarter. Crypto revenue was $38 million, down 1% quarter-over-quarter.
The company added 120,0000 funded accounts to end the quarter with a total of 23.1 million. Monthly active users were up 0.4 million in the quarter to 11.8 million.
The company ended the quarter with $5.5 billion in cash.
“We had a great ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: Masimo's Skyrocketing Growth: Analyst Boosts Price Target Amid Exciting New Ventures
articles.content:
Needham analyst Mike Matson reiterated a Buy rating on the shares of Masimo Corporation (NASDAQ: MASI), raising the price target to $207.00 from $192.00.
The analyst believes that new product launches, market share gains, and new businesses such as hospital automation should enable continued strong growth in Masimo's medical business.
Mainly, the acquisition of Sound United provides the company with strong consumer brands and a distribution channel for its nascent consumer health business, including its W1 smartwatch.
Masimo's consumer health strategy is progressing and ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: Carl Icahn rebuts short seller Hindenburg Research's report. It’s already cost his company $6 billion in market cap.
articles.content: Icahn Enterprises rebutted a short-selling report accusing it of inflating asset values that has cost it $6 billion of market cap in a few weeks.

articles.title: S&P Settles Lower Ahead Of CPI; Market Volatility Increases
articles.content:
The S&P 500 closed lower on Tuesday ahead of consumer price index report.
Disappointing projections from companies, including,  PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: PYPL) and  Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ: SWKS) also weighed on overall market sentiment. The Philadelphia SE Semiconductor Index dropped around 1.9% on Tuesday.
